findings.title: Coding Style Issues in the Contract
findings.description: Code readability of a Smart Contract is largely influenced by the Coding Style issues and in some specific scenarios may lead to bugs in the future.

findings.title: NatSpec Annotations must be included
findings.description: The smart contracts do not include the NatSpec annotations adequately.

findings.title: Commented codes must be wiped-out before deployment
findings.description: The Tourniverse contract includes quite a few commented codes in the excludeFromReward function which badly affects the readability of the code.

findings.title: Constant declaration should be preferred
findings.description: State variables that are not supposed to change throughout the contract should be declared as constant.

findings.title: Too many Digits used
findings.description: The code has a large number of digits that reduces the readability of the code.
